data.enText: told
told

data.chText: 提供信息
data.enText: give information

data.chText: 告诉；告知
data.enText: to give information to sb by speaking or writing

data.chText: 他逢人便讲这个消息。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: He told the news to everybody he saw.

data.chText: 他逢人便讲这个消息。
data.enText: He told everybody he saw the news.

data.chText: 为什么没人把这次事故告诉我？
data.enText: Why wasn't I told about the accident?

data.chText: 她告诉你她的姓名了吗？

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: Did she tell you her name?

data.chText: 我跟你说什么来着？
data.enText: What did I tell you ? (= you should have listened to my advice)

data.chText: 他们已跟我们说过不来了。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语 (+ that从句)

data.enText: They've told us (that) they're not coming.

data.chText: 我不住告诉自己一切都没问题。
data.enText: I kept telling myself (that) everything was OK.

data.chText: 你是说在这件事情上你没有得到过任何帮助吗？
data.enText: Are you telling me you didn't have any help with this? (= I don't believe what you have said)

data.chText: 告诉我你住哪儿？
data.enText: Tell me where you live.

data.chText: “我可以走了。”他对她说。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+直接引语

data.enText: ‘I'm ready to go now,’ he told her.

data.chText: 提供（情况）；说明；显示

before.enText: of some writing, an instrument, a sign, etc.

data.enText: to give information about sth

data.chText: 这则广告提供的产品情况很少。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: The advertisement told us very little about the product.

data.chText: 这油表显示还剩有多少燃料。
data.enText: This gauge tells you how much fuel you have left.

data.chText: 她从他呼吸的声音中听出来他睡着了。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语 (+ that从句)

data.enText: The sound of his breathing told her (that) he was asleep.

data.chText: 用言语表达
data.enText: express in words

data.chText: 讲述；说；表达
data.enText: to express sth in words

data.chText: 讲故事；说笑话；撒谎
data.enText: to tell stories/jokes/lies

data.chText: 你说的真是实话吗？
data.enText: Are you sure you're telling the truth ?

data.chText: 我无法向你表达我多么高兴。
data.enText: I can't tell you how happy I am.

data.chText: 秘密
data.enText: secret

data.chText: 泄露（秘密）；告发
data.enText: to let sb know a secret

data.chText: 你要保证不往外讲。
data.enText: Promise you won't tell.

data.chText: “你今晚要和谁约会？”“那可不能讲！”（是个秘密）
data.enText: ‘Who are you going out with tonight?’ ‘ That would be telling !’ (= it's a secret)

data.chText: 命令
data.enText: order

data.chText: 命令；指示；吩咐
data.enText: to order or advise sb to do sth

data.chText: 有人吩咐他坐下等着。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: He was told to sit down and wait.

data.chText: 有一个让汽车司机减速的指示牌。
data.enText: There was a sign telling motorists to slow down.

data.chText: 我不断叮嘱自己要保持冷静。
data.enText: I kept telling myself to keep calm.

data.chText: 你要照我的吩咐做。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: Do what I tell you.

data.chText: 孩子们必须听话。
data.enText: Children must do as they're told .

data.chText: 别跟我说该怎么办！
data.enText: Don't tell me what to do!

data.chText: 医生嘱咐我要少吃油腻。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语 (+ that从句)

data.enText: The doctor told me (that) I should eat less fat.

data.chText: 知道；判断
data.enText: know/judge

data.chText: 知道；看出；确切地判断

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to know, see or judge sth correctly

data.chText: 我想他是幸福的。这很难说。
data.enText: I think he's happy. It's hard to tell .

data.chText: 据我判断，她喜欢这门课程。
data.enText: As far as I can tell , she's enjoying the course.

data.chText: 从他的表情我看得出他生气了。
data.enText: I could tell (that) he was angry from his expression.

data.chText: “那不是正本。”“你怎么知道的？”
data.enText: ‘That's not an original.’ ‘How can you tell?’

data.chText: 要判定是否喜欢一件东西，唯一的办法是试一试。
data.enText: The only way to tell if you like something is by trying it.

data.chText: 辨别
data.enText: distinguish

data.chText: 识别；分辨；区分；辨认

before.chText: 不用于进行时或被动语态
before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses or in the passive

data.enText: to distinguish one thing or person from another

data.chText: 很难分辨出这两个版本有什么区别。
data.enText: It was hard to tell the difference between the two versions.

data.chText: 你能分得出汤姆和他的孪生弟弟吗？
data.enText: Can you tell Tom from his twin brother?

data.chText: 很难把他们区分开来。
data.enText: It's difficult to tell them apart .

data.chText: 这些小猫看上去一模一样，你怎么能分辨出哪只是哪只呢？
data.enText: The kittens look exactly alike─how can you tell which is which ?

data.chText: 有影响
data.enText: have effect

data.chText: 产生效果，发生影响（尤指负面影响）
data.enText: to have an effect on sb/sth, especially a bad one

data.chText: 过度的疲劳开始让救援队吃不消了。
data.enText: The strain was beginning to tell on the rescue team.
all told

data.chText: 合计；总共
data.enText: with all people, etc. counted and included

data.chText: 总共有52人要来。
data.enText: There are 52 people coming, all told.
don't tell me

data.chText: （用以表示知道或猜得出他人要说什么）不至于…吧，别又要说…了吧
data.enText: used to say that you know or can guess what sb is going to say, especially because it is typical of them

data.chText: 你不至于又迟到了吧！
data.enText: Don't tell me you were late again!
I/I'll tell you what

data.chText: 我的建议是；听我说
data.enText: used to introduce a suggestion

data.chText: 听我说，咱们还是待在家里吧。
data.enText: I'll tell you what─let's stay in instead.
I tell you
I can tell you
I'm telling you

data.chText: 我可以肯定地说；我敢说；确实
data.enText: used to emphasize what you are saying, especially when it is surprising or difficult to believe

data.chText: 我敢说，这并不便宜！
data.enText: It isn't cheap, I can tell you!

data.chText: 我可以肯定地说，那正是她的原话。
data.enText: I'm telling you, that's exactly what she said.
I told you (so)

data.chText: 我提醒过你要出事；不听好人言，吃亏在眼前
data.enText: used when sth bad has happened, to remind sb that you warned them about it and they did not listen to you
live, etc. to tell the tale

data.chText: 幸免于难之后向人讲述真实经历
data.enText: to survive a difficult or dangerous experience so that you can tell others what really happened
tell a different story/tale

data.chText: 说的情况迥然不同；讲出来的是另一回事
data.enText: to give some information that is different from what you expect or have been told
tell its own tale/story

data.chText: 不言而喻；不释自明；无须解释
data.enText: to explain itself, without needing any further explanation or comment

data.chText: 看她的面部表情，就什么都明白了。
data.enText: Her face told its own story.
tell me

data.chText: （用以引出问题）告诉我，跟我说实话
data.enText: used to introduce a question

data.chText: 跟我说实话，你吃过午餐没有？
data.enText: Tell me, have you had lunch yet?
tell me about it

data.chText: 你算说对了；的确
data.enText: used to say that you understand what sb is talking about and have had the same experience

data.chText: “史蒂夫把我烦透了！”“你算说对了。他快把我逼疯了。”
data.enText: ‘I get so annoyed with Steve!’ ‘Tell me about it. He drives me crazy.’
tell me another!

data.chText: 不见得吧；我不相信；别瞎扯
data.enText: used to tell sb that you do not believe what they have said
tell tales (about sth/on sb)

data.chText: 揭人短处；说长道短
data.enText: to tell sb about sth that another person has done wrong
tell the time
tell time

data.chText: （根据钟表等）说出时间；报时
data.enText: to read the time from a clock, etc.

data.chText: 她才五岁，还没有学会看钟表。
data.enText: She's only five─she hasn't learnt to tell the time yet.
tell sb where to get off/where they can get off

data.chText: 警告某人的行为不可容忍；不吃某人的这一套
data.enText: to make it clear to sb that you will no longer accept their bad behaviour
tell sb where to put/stick sth
tell sb what they can do with sth

data.chText: 别来这一套；让某人收起…的一套
data.enText: to make it clear to sb that you are angry and are rejecting what they are offering you
there's no telling

data.chText: 无法知道；难以预料
data.enText: used to say that it is impossible to know what happened or will happen

data.chText: 说不准他们会有什么反应。
data.enText: There's no telling how they'll react.
to tell (you) the truth

data.chText: 说实话；老实说；说真的
data.enText: used when admitting sth

data.chText: 说实话，我在她讲话过程中睡着了。
data.enText: To tell the truth, I fell asleep in the middle of her talk.
you can never tell
you never can tell

data.chText: 谁也拿不准；谁也说不清；很难说
data.enText: you can never be sure, for example because things are not always what they appear to be
you're telling me!

data.chText: 我完全同意；的确如此
data.enText: I completely agree with you
kiss and tell

data.chText: （通常为了获利）泄露与名人的私情
data.enText: a way of referring to sb talking publicly, usually for money, about a past sexual relationship with sb famous
a little bird told me

data.chText: （不想说出是谁告诉的）有人告诉我的，不告诉你我是怎么知道的
data.enText: used to say that sb told you sth but you do not want to say who it was
know/tell sb a thing or two (about sb/sth)

data.chText: 了解 / 透露有用的（或有趣的、意外的）信息；有所了解 / 披露；见多识广
data.enText: to know/tell sb some useful, interesting or surprising information about sb/sth

data.chText: 她结过五次婚，所以对男人有所了解。
data.enText: She's been married five times, so she knows a thing or two about men!
if (the) truth be known/told

data.chText: （用于说出真相）说实话，说真的，老实说
data.enText: used to tell sb the true facts about a situation, especially when these are not known by other people
tell against sb

data.chText: 对…不利
data.enText: to be a disadvantage to sb

data.chText: 她缺乏经验对她不利。
data.enText: Her lack of experience told against her.
tell of sth

data.chText: 公布；说明

data.enText: or
to make sth known; to give an account of sth

data.chText: 公布拟裁员的通知
data.enText: notices telling of the proposed job cuts
tell sb↔off (for sth/for doing sth)

data.chText: 责备；斥责；责骂；数落
data.enText: to speak angrily to sb for doing sth wrong

data.chText: 孩子们太吵，我把他们训斥了一顿。
data.enText: I told the boys off for making so much noise.

data.chText: 你挨骂了没有？
data.enText: Did you get told off?
tell on sb

data.chText: 告发；打…的小报告；告…的状
data.enText: to tell a person in authority about sth bad that sb has done

data.chText: 答应我，别告发我！
data.enText: Promise not to tell on me!

data.chText: 以上各词均含命令、指挥、要求之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to use your position of authority to say to sb that they must do sth.
order

data.chText: 指命令、指挥、要求：
data.enText: to use your position of authority to tell sb to do sth

data.chText: 公司被勒令向以前的员工作出补偿。
data.enText: The company was ordered to pay compensation to its former employee.

data.chText: “马上过来！”她命令道。
data.enText: ‘Come here at once!’ she ordered.
tell

data.chText: 指命令、指示、吩咐：
data.enText: to say to sb that they must or should do sth

data.chText: 有人吩咐他坐下等着。
data.enText: He was told to sit down and wait.

data.chText: 别对我指手画脚的！
data.enText: Don't tell me what to do!
instruct

data.chText: 尤指以正式或官方的方式指示、命令、吩咐：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to tell sb to do sth, especially in a formal or official way

data.chText: 那封信指示他立即向总部汇报。
data.enText: The letter instructed him to report to headquarters immediately.
direct

data.chText: 指正式发出指示、命令：
data.enText: ( formal ) to give an official order

data.chText: 法官指示陪审团作出无罪裁决。
data.enText: The judge directed the jury to return a verdict of not guilty.
command

data.chText: 指利用权力命令：
data.enText: to use your position of authority to tell sb to do sth

data.chText: 他命令手下撤退。
data.enText: He commanded his men to retreat.

data.chText: 用order还是command？
order较command通用，可用于任何权威人物命令他人做某事，如父母、老师或政府。command的语气稍强于order，可能暗指有人反对这命令，或如果允许的话，有人会反对。command是部队长官发布命令的一般用词，或者用于发布一般没有商量余地的命令。该词不大可能用于父母或老师。
data.enText: Order is a more general word than command and can be used about anyone in a position of authority, such as a parent, teacher or government telling sb to do sth. Command is slightly stronger than order and can suggest that there is some opposition to the order, or would be if opposition were allowed. It is the normal word to use about an army officer giving orders, or in any context where it is normal to give orders without any discussion about them. It is less likely to be used about a parent or teacher.
order or command?
to order/tell/instruct/direct/command sb to do sth
to order/tell/instruct/direct/command sb that…
to order/instruct/direct/command that…
to do sth as ordered/told/instructed/directed/commanded

data.chText: say从不以人作宾语，可说say something或say something to somebody。say常与直接引语连用：
data.enText: Say never has a person as the object. You say something or say something to somebody . Say is often used when you are giving somebody’s exact words.

data.chText: “坐下。”她说。
data.enText: ‘Sit down’, she said.

data.chText: 安妮说：“我累了。”
data.enText: Anne said, ‘I’m tired.’

data.chText: 安妮说她累了。
data.enText: Anne said (that) she was tired.

data.chText: 他对你说了些什么？
data.enText: What did he say to you?

data.chText: 不能用say about，但可说say something about：
data.enText: You cannot use ‘say about’, but say something about is correct.

data.chText: 我想谈谈我的家庭。
data.enText: I want to say something/a few words/a little about my family.

data.chText: 没有指明说话对象时，say亦可与从句连用：
data.enText: Say can also be used with a clause when the person you are talking to is not mentioned.

data.chText: 她没说她想做什么。
data.enText: She didn't say what she intended to do.

data.chText: tell常带有两个宾语，其中一个通常是人：
data.enText: Tell usually has a person as the object and often has two objects.

data.chText: 你告诉他这消息了吗？
data.enText: Have you told him the news yet?

data.chText: 该词常与that从句连用：
data.enText: It is often used with ‘that’ clauses.

data.chText: 安妮对我说她累了。
data.enText: Anne told me (that) she was tired.

data.chText: tell在某人告知事实或提供信息时使用，常与what、where等词连用：
data.enText: Tell is usually used when somebody is giving facts or information, often with what , where , etc.

data.chText: 你能告诉我电影什么时候开演吗？
data.enText: Can you tell me when the movie starts?

data.chText: 但：
data.enText: (BUT

data.chText: 你能给我讲讲这所学校的情况吗？
data.enText: Can you give me some information about the school?

data.chText: 发出指示时亦可用tell：
data.enText: ) Tell is also used when you are giving somebody instructions.

data.chText: 医生要我卧床休息。
data.enText: The doctor told me to stay in bed.

data.chText: 医生对我说我必须卧床休息。
data.enText: The doctor told me (that) I had to stay in bed.

data.chText: 或
data.enText: OR

data.chText: 医生说我必须卧床休息。
data.enText: The doctor said (that) I had to stay in bed.

data.chText: 不能说：
data.enText: NOT
The doctor said me to stay in bed.

means: 产生效果，发生影响（尤指负面影响）
[考古学]（古代村落遗址堆积而成的）台形土墩

ex.chText: 你想说的话都说完了吗?
ex.enText: Did you finish what you wanted to say?
How do you say this in Japanese?

ex.chText: 她向老师说了声“早上好”。
ex.enText: She said 'Good Morning' to the teacher.
The letter says that he will come next week.

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，指用语言表达思想，侧重于所说的具体内容，通常用作及物动词。

ex.chText: 那孩子还没有学会说话。
ex.enText: The child hasn't learnt to speak yet.

synonyms.bx: 用作不及物动词时，侧重指说话的动作而非内容，可指长篇演讲或三言两语的交谈，也可指简单的开口说话的能力；用作及物动词时，其宾语常为某种语言。

ex.enText: Human beings can talk while animals can't.

ex.chText: 他若想商谈什么事情，本可以到办公室来。
ex.enText: He could have come to the office if he wanted to talk.
I don't understand what you're talking about.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，用作不及物动词时，侧重指与人交谈时的连续说话，可指单方面较长谈话，和 speak 一样，强调说话的动作而非内容；用作及物动词时，宾语多为 sense，nonsense，business，rubbish 等。

ex.chText: 请告诉我你的住址和电话号码。
ex.enText: Tell me your address and telephone number, please.

ex.chText: 你可以告诉他们，我希望明晚回来。
ex.enText: You can tell them that I hope to be back by tomorrow night.

ex.chText: 指示灯告诉你机器是否在工作。
ex.enText: The light tells you if the machine is on.

ex.chText: 母亲叫她别跟陌生人说话。
ex.enText: Her mother told her not to talk to any strangers.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指直接给某人讲述或以间接的方式转述某事，有时含嘱托、命令之意，常后接双宾语或复合宾语。

data.enText: all told

data.chText: 合计；总共
data.enText: with all people, etc. counted and included

data.chText: 总共有52人要来。
data.enText: There are 52 people coming, all told.
don't tell me

data.chText: （用以表示知道或猜得出他人要说什么）不至于…吧，别又要说…了吧
data.enText: used to say that you know or can guess what sb is going to say, especially because it is typical of them

data.chText: 你不至于又迟到了吧！
data.enText: Don't tell me you were late again!
I/I'll tell you what

data.chText: 我的建议是；听我说
data.enText: used to introduce a suggestion

data.chText: 听我说，咱们还是待在家里吧。
data.enText: I'll tell you what─let's stay in instead.
I tell you
I can tell you
I'm telling you

data.chText: 我可以肯定地说；我敢说；确实
data.enText: used to emphasize what you are saying, especially when it is surprising or difficult to believe

data.chText: 我敢说，这并不便宜！
data.enText: It isn't cheap, I can tell you!

data.chText: 我可以肯定地说，那正是她的原话。
data.enText: I'm telling you, that's exactly what she said.
I told you (so)

data.chText: 我提醒过你要出事；不听好人言，吃亏在眼前
data.enText: used when sth bad has happened, to remind sb that you warned them about it and they did not listen to you
live, etc. to tell the tale

data.chText: 幸免于难之后向人讲述真实经历
data.enText: to survive a difficult or dangerous experience so that you can tell others what really happened
tell a different story/tale

data.chText: 说的情况迥然不同；讲出来的是另一回事
data.enText: to give some information that is different from what you expect or have been told
tell its own tale/story

data.chText: 不言而喻；不释自明；无须解释
data.enText: to explain itself, without needing any further explanation or comment

data.chText: 看她的面部表情，就什么都明白了。
data.enText: Her face told its own story.
tell me

data.chText: （用以引出问题）告诉我，跟我说实话
data.enText: used to introduce a question

data.chText: 跟我说实话，你吃过午餐没有？
data.enText: Tell me, have you had lunch yet?
tell me about it

data.chText: 你算说对了；的确
data.enText: used to say that you understand what sb is talking about and have had the same experience

data.chText: “史蒂夫把我烦透了！”“你算说对了。他快把我逼疯了。”
data.enText: ‘I get so annoyed with Steve!’ ‘Tell me about it. He drives me crazy.’
tell me another!

data.chText: 不见得吧；我不相信；别瞎扯
data.enText: used to tell sb that you do not believe what they have said
tell tales (about sth/on sb)

data.chText: 揭人短处；说长道短
data.enText: to tell sb about sth that another person has done wrong
tell the time
tell time

data.chText: （根据钟表等）说出时间；报时
data.enText: to read the time from a clock, etc.

data.chText: 她才五岁，还没有学会看钟表。
data.enText: She's only five─she hasn't learnt to tell the time yet.
tell sb where to get off/where they can get off

data.chText: 警告某人的行为不可容忍；不吃某人的这一套
data.enText: to make it clear to sb that you will no longer accept their bad behaviour
tell sb where to put/stick sth
tell sb what they can do with sth

data.chText: 别来这一套；让某人收起…的一套
data.enText: to make it clear to sb that you are angry and are rejecting what they are offering you
there's no telling

data.chText: 无法知道；难以预料
data.enText: used to say that it is impossible to know what happened or will happen

data.chText: 说不准他们会有什么反应。
data.enText: There's no telling how they'll react.
to tell (you) the truth

data.chText: 说实话；老实说；说真的
data.enText: used when admitting sth

data.chText: 说实话，我在她讲话过程中睡着了。
data.enText: To tell the truth, I fell asleep in the middle of her talk.
you can never tell
you never can tell

data.chText: 谁也拿不准；谁也说不清；很难说
data.enText: you can never be sure, for example because things are not always what they appear to be
you're telling me!

data.chText: 我完全同意；的确如此
data.enText: I completely agree with you
hear tell (of sth)

data.chText: 听到人谈论（某事）；听说

data.enText: or
to hear people talking about sth

data.chText: 我常听到人谈起这种事。
data.enText: I've often heard tell of such things.
kiss and tell

data.chText: （通常为了获利）泄露与名人的私情
data.enText: a way of referring to sb talking publicly, usually for money, about a past sexual relationship with sb famous
a little bird told me

data.chText: （不想说出是谁告诉的）有人告诉我的，不告诉你我是怎么知道的
data.enText: used to say that sb told you sth but you do not want to say who it was
know/tell sb a thing or two (about sb/sth)

data.chText: 了解 / 透露有用的（或有趣的、意外的）信息；有所了解 / 披露；见多识广
data.enText: to know/tell sb some useful, interesting or surprising information about sb/sth

data.chText: 她结过五次婚，所以对男人有所了解。
data.enText: She's been married five times, so she knows a thing or two about men!
time (alone) will tell
only time will tell

data.chText: （只有）时间会证明
data.enText: used to say that you will have to wait for some time to find out the result of a situation

data.chText: 只有时间才能证明这种疗法是否成功。
data.enText: Only time will tell if the treatment has been successful.
if (the) truth be known/told

data.chText: （用于说出真相）说实话，说真的，老实说
data.enText: used to tell sb the true facts about a situation, especially when these are not known by other people
tell against sb

data.chText: 对…不利
data.enText: to be a disadvantage to sb

data.chText: 她缺乏经验对她不利。
data.enText: Her lack of experience told against her.
tell of sth

data.chText: 公布；说明

data.enText: or
to make sth known; to give an account of sth

data.chText: 公布拟裁员的通知
data.enText: notices telling of the proposed job cuts
tell sb↔off (for sth/for doing sth)

data.chText: 责备；斥责；责骂；数落
data.enText: to speak angrily to sb for doing sth wrong

data.chText: 孩子们太吵，我把他们训斥了一顿。
data.enText: I told the boys off for making so much noise.

data.chText: 你挨骂了没有？
data.enText: Did you get told off?
tell on sb

data.chText: 告发；打…的小报告；告…的状
data.enText: to tell a person in authority about sth bad that sb has done

data.chText: 答应我，别告发我！
data.enText: Promise not to tell on me!

example: We distinguish several kinds of maple
He could tell that she was unhappy

tr: give instructions to or direct somebody to do something with authority
example: I said to him to go home
She ordered him to do the shopping
The mother told the child to get dressed
Tell them that you will be late

tr: narrate or give a detailed account of
example: The father told a story to his child
he was telling on all his former colleague
He said that he wanted to marry her
tell me what is bothering you

tr: inform positively and with certainty and confidence
example: I tell you that man is a crook!

value.def: If you tell someone something, you give them information.

example.ex: In the evening I returned to tell Phyllis our relationship was over...
example.tran: 晚上我回来告诉菲莉丝我们之间完了。

example.ex: I called Andie to tell her how spectacular the stuff looked...
example.tran: 我打电话告诉安迪，那东西看上去太棒了。

example.ex: Claire had made me promise to tell her the truth...
example.tran: 克莱尔要我保证把真相告诉她。

example.ex: I only told the truth to the press when the single was released as it seemed the perfect time to do it...
example.tran: 等到单曲唱片开始发行时，我才把真相透露给媒体，因为那似乎是最佳时机。

example.ex: Tell us about your moment on the summit...
example.tran: 说说你登上顶峰的那一刻，心里是怎么想的。

example.ex: Her voice breaking with emotion, she told him: 'It doesn't seem fair'.
example.tran: 她激动得声音颤抖，对他说：“这好像不公平吧。”

value.def: If you tell something such as a joke, a story, or your personal experiences, you communicate it to other people using speech.

example.ex: His friends say he was always quick to tell a joke...
example.tran: 他的朋友们说，以前他讲笑话总是张嘴就来。

example.ex: He told his story to The Sunday Times and produced photographs...
example.tran: 他把自己的经历讲述给了《星期日泰晤士报》的记者，还提供了照片。

example.ex: Will you tell me a story?
example.tran: 能讲个故事给我听吗？

value.tran: 说(笑话);讲(故事);讲述(个人经历)

value.def: If you tell someone to do something, you order or advise them to do it.

example.ex: A passer-by told the driver to move his car so that it was not causing an obstruction...
example.tran: 一个过路人叫那个司机把他的车挪一挪，免得挡道。

example.ex: She told me on the telephone to come help clean the house.
example.tran: 她在电话里叫我过去帮忙打扫屋子。

value.def: If you tell yourself something, you put it into words in your own mind because you need to encourage or persuade yourself about something.

example.ex: 'Come on', she told herself...
example.tran: “加油！”她在心里暗暗打气。

example.ex: I told myself I would be satisfied with whatever I could get.
example.tran: 我告诉自己，不管得到什么我都会心满意足的。

value.boxu_tran: 注意，动词tell后面往往跟一个表示听话者的直接宾语：He told Alison he was suffering from leukaemia (他告诉艾莉森他患了白血病)，What did she tell you (她对你说了些什么)。句子 What did she tell to you 是错误的。不过，用动词 say 时，若要提及听话者，应该用介词 to，What did she say you 不对，What did she say to you 是对的。tell 用来转述信息：The manufacturer told me that the product did not contain corn (制造商告诉我该产品不含谷物)。tell 也可以和 to 连用，用来转述命令、指示：My mother told me to shut up and eat my dinner (我妈叫我别说话专心吃饭)。转述某人说的话时，动词 say 最为常用。
value.boxu_usage: Note that the verb tell is usually followed by a direct object indicating the person who is being addressed. He told Alison he was suffering from leukaemia... What did she tell you? 'What did she tell to you?' is wrong. With the verb say, however, if you want to mention the person who is being addressed, you should use the preposition to. 'What did she say you?' is wrong. 'What did she say to you?' is correct. Tell is used to report information that is given to someone. The manufacturer told me that the product did not contain corn. Tell can also be used with a 'to' infinitive to report an order or instruction. My mother told me to shut up and eat my dinner. Say is the most general verb for reporting the words that someone speaks.

value.def: If you can tell what is happening or what is true, you are able to judge correctly what is happening or what is true.

example.ex: It was already impossible to tell where the bullet had entered...
example.tran: 已经无法判断子弹是从哪里打进来的。

example.ex: I couldn't tell if he had been in a fight or had just fallen down...
example.tran: 我不知道他是和人家打架了，还是仅仅摔了一跤。

example.ex: You can tell he's joking.
example.tran: 你能看出来他是在开玩笑。

value.def: If you can tell one thing from another, you are able to recognize the difference between it and other similar things.

example.ex: I can't really tell the difference between their policies and ours...
example.tran: 我真的看不出他们的政策和我们的有什么不同。

example.ex: How do you tell one from another?...
example.tran: 你怎么把他们区分开来？

example.ex: I had to look twice to tell which was Martinez; they all looked alike.
example.tran: 我得仔细看一下才能认出哪个是马丁内斯，他们长得实在太像了。

value.def: If you tell, you reveal or give away a secret.

example.ex: Many of the children know who they are but are not telling.
example.tran: 许多孩子知道他们是谁，可就是不说。

value.def: If facts or events tell you something, they reveal certain information to you through ways other than speech.

example.ex: The facts tell us that this is not true...
example.tran: 事实告诉我们，这不是真的。

example.ex: I don't think the unemployment rate ever tells us much about the future...
example.tran: 我认为，从失业率上永远看不出未来的情况究竟如何。

example.ex: The evidence of our eyes tells us a different story...
example.tran: 我们亲眼所见的可不是那么一回事。

example.ex: While most of us feel fairly complacent about the nutrients we're getting from our diets, the facts tell a very different story.
example.tran: 虽然我们大多数人对于从饮食中获取的营养成分感到相当满足，实际情况却不是这样。

value.def: If an unpleasant or tiring experience begins to tell, it begins to have a serious effect.

example.ex: The pressure began to tell as rain closed in after 20 laps...
example.tran: 跑完 20 圈以后，眼看就要下雨了，大家开始紧张起来。

example.ex: The strains of office are beginning to tell on the prime minister.
example.tran: 首相开始感到公务繁忙的压力了。

value.tran: (不快的或令人疲倦的经历)产生效果，产生影响

value.def: You use as far as I can tell or so far as I could tell to indicate that what you are saying is based on the information you have, but that there may be things you do not know.

example.ex: As far as I can tell, Jason is basically a nice guy...
example.tran: 据我所知，贾森算得上是个好人。

example.ex: So far as anyone can tell, there's evidence that there was a Robin Hood...
example.tran: 众所周知，有证据表明确实有罗宾汉这么个人。

example.ex: As far as I could tell, neither of us was under observation.
example.tran: 据我所知，我们俩都没有受到监视。

value.def: You can say 'I tell you', 'I can tell you', or 'I can't tell you' to add emphasis to what you are saying.

example.ex: I tell you this, I will not rest until that day has come...
example.tran: 我可以肯定地说，不到那天我不会休息。

example.ex: This little letter gave us a few chuckles, I can tell you...
example.tran: 说真的，我们看了这封短信都笑了。

example.ex: I can't tell you how glad I was to leave that place.
example.tran: 我无法形容自己离开那个地方心里有多高兴。

value.tran: (用来强调所说的话)我可以肯定/我敢说/我没法形容

value.def: If you say 'You never can tell', you mean that the future is always uncertain and it is never possible to know exactly what will happen.

example.ex: You never can tell what life is going to bring you.
example.tran: 你永远不知道人生会给你带来些什么。

value.def: If someone disagrees with you or refuses to do what you suggest and you are eventually proved to be right, you can say 'I told you so'.

example.ex: Her parents did not approve of her decision and, if she failed, her mother would say, 'I told you so.'
example.tran: 她父母不赞同她的决定，要是她失败了，她妈妈就会说：“怎么样，我说对了吧？”

value.tran: 我早就告诉过你;我说的没错吧

value.def: You use I'll tell you what or I tell you what to introduce a suggestion or a new topic of conversation.

example.ex: I tell you what, I'll bring the water in a separate glass.
example.tran: 要不这样吧，我用另一个玻璃杯把水端过来。

value.tran: 我的建议是，听我说(用来引出建议或转换话题)

queryExplainVideo.detail: 如何区分 say 和 tell？
